description:
Super pleasant coffee house in the sunset. The pour overs were done perfectly. 

Tons of seating throughout. Overall great service.
author: Nick F.

description:
I am from out of town and was really hoping to find my new favorite coffee spot. 

This coffee shop has friendly baristas and a great ambiance, however, the coffee was sub par. 

Purchased: 
Black Drip Coffee: 3/10
Oat milk Mocha: 2/10
Plain Croissant: 6/10
Almond Croissant: 8/10
author: Andrew H.

description:
I love grabbing a cup of coffee from here whenever I'm in the Inner Sunset! I usually take my coffee to go as there are never seats available, but it's ok because the interior is dimly lit and sometimes stuffy. There's a cute bench outside though, but I don't have a problem with taking my coffee to go. 

The coffee itself is good--one of the better tasting coffee in the city. Highly recommend for someone looking to walk around with a cup of coffee.
author: Kamille V.

description:
A hip and cute coffee shop in inner sunset!

I come here because I love the cozy and warm vibes this place give! Though it looks small, it's spacious and I always happen to find seating right away. 

My favorite is Spaniard which is Spanish latte with condensed milk. It's bit sweet but pretty delicious! You must give it a try because it will warm your soul :) Their matcha latte is pretty good but just standard. 

Highly recommend this place especially on a cold windy day!
author: Clare L.

description:
I'm not often in the Inner Sunset these days, but when I stop by, Snowbird Coffee is now one of my favorite places to visit. This is a charming coffee shop on 9th Avenue, and the wooden furniture and soft lighting makes this a perfect place if you are looking for a workspace or just a cafe to meet up with a friend to chat for a while. 

I've tried several of their espresso-based drinks and have not been disappointed. Their Americanos are great, but if you have a sweet tooth, they have a few drinks that include condensed milk as one of the ingredients. I've tried their café bombón, which takes a base of condensed milk and adds a double shot of espresso. The bitterness of the espresso balances the milk well, and it makes me nostalgic for those old days studying abroad in Spain (where I'd get a café biberon at the local cafes). 

Seating is limited, but I've never had a problem finding a table for myself. You should give this place a try!
author: Keith H.

description:
Was in the area so I decided to try out this cute little coffee shop. 

Upon walking in, I was greeted by the cashier who explained the menu to us and told us which drinks were most popular. I went with her recommendation of the Spaniard, a Spanish latte with condensed milk. I really enjoyed this drink and found that it had a good amount of sweetness - it was the perfect accompaniment to a little work session. 

The space is pretty small with single tables as well as a mini bar area so I wouldn't really recommend it for large groups unless you're getting your drinks to go but I will say that there's adequate room to get your work done if you're just planning on using your laptop! It is a bit dim in the back though so it's not the best work space in that sense. 

Overall my drink was tasty, the price was reasonable and competitive with others, and service was very friendly! I'll definitely be back again to try some of the other specialty drinks.
author: Janice L.

description:
Discovered this cute coffee shop while walking around the Sunset area! Since this was my first time, I asked for a recommendation and the lady recommended their popular drink- the Spaniard which is their Spanish latte with condensed milk. If you like sweeter coffee, this is perfect for you! It's not too sweet but enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. 

Bonus to them for having a water station :) love it when I don't need to ask them for water and I can get the water myself
author: Frances K.

description: A hidden gem if there ever was one. Snowbird doesn't get quite as much attention as the city's flashy, headline-making cafes but its coffee more than measures up. I've never had a bad drink here. Plus, they do a quality matcha latte, have free wi-fi and there's never, ever a line.
author: Elena K.

description:
Amazing customer service 
Great place to bring your work 
Comfy environment
Free wifi! 
2 output for charging 
Quiet and chill
Fantastic tasting latte  
I am looking forward to return! Great place to study! 
Strongly recommended if you're looking for the perfect coffee shop to get your work done! 
Come
author: Coco B.

description:
I really enjoyed their iced lattes. My boyfriend quickly ordered and brought the drinks to me as I was parking the car. 

He says he really likes Snowbird because of their coffee and because of their higher yelp ratings. I would like to come back here soon to try other drinks on their menu and enjoy the coffee shop. :)
author: Heather I.

description:
More businesses deserve better ratings. Why should this coffee spot rank at 4 stars or even 3? Well good thing it doesn't. 5 stars all the way.

Friendly staff with damn good coffee. I enjoyed a refreshing iced coffee while admiring the patrons surrounding me. This place is filled with people working, conversing, reading, you name it. Definitely a spot to sit and relax while the scent of fresh coffee lingers in the air.

Keep up the good work Snowbird.
author: Kevin J.

description:
This small coffee shop is a nice spot for hanging out with friends. There are only a few tables and all of them are pretty tiny, so I wouldn't recommend bringing a laptop to work here. The area I was sitting at did not have any power outlets either.

I ordered a macchiato, expecting it to be a normal sized one like what Starbucks serves, but disappointingly found out it's an expresso shot. My fault for not paying close enough attention to the menu as the ounces are listed next to each drink. It was good and it came with some sparkling water, but I think it's overpriced.

Street parking was plentiful. There are many 2-hour parking spots a block or two away, and metered spots right outside the shop.
author: Wesley S.

description:
I come here almost everyday for their special coffees. My favorite is the Spaniard, which is a Spanish latte with a splash of condense milk. The coffee is so smooth and silky with the condense milk. I usually don't add any sugar to my coffee. The condense milk was not overly sweet as I thought it would be. 

The baristas are always nice and sweet. I love this cute little coffee shop.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I love this spot in the Inner Sunset! The people who work here are super friendly and nice. The music is great and the vibe trendy.
I stop in here once a week or so for an oat milk matcha latte. The matcha they use is very good quality and I love that they carry oat milk! 
Friends of mine have said their coffee is good; they have some creative drinks on the menu.
Highly recommend!
author: D H.

description: Delicious cappuccino with a cozy and warm atmosphere. The tables are a bit small but good for a relaxed solo/couple coffee. Not much more to say except I will be back when I need a cino!
author: Tristan L.

description:
Splendid cappuccino and quick service! I made a quick stop here before museum hopping in GGP. Really rich flavor and great latte art :o)

I can't speak to much else, but while I was waiting for my coffee, I did notice a lack of outlets and how dimly lit and low-ceilinged the space is, so this was a perfect place to go in and out rather than sit and do work.
author: Vicky N.

description: This was a very cute place and had super nice service, however I am very disappointed in the fact that the hot coco wasn't good :/ I didn't taste any of there other things, but if they can't make hot chocolate I don't think they are able to make coffee... completely my opinion.
author: Kiana S.

description:
This local coffee shop is lovely and staff is always very kind and helpful when I come in. I usually get the Spaniard which is espresso with steamed and condensed milk. There's a nice sweetness to it but not overpowering! Good hot and iced. 

The space itself is quite small but there are small tables if you are working on a laptop alone but there is not a lot of counter space so I wouldn't recommend groups. It is also lowly lit which isn't a bad thing but definitely something to keep in mind if you are looking for a good work or study space. Also have to mention that outlets are hard to find so make sure your laptop is charged before coming!
author: Christina C.

description: This has become my favorite place to get coffee in the city! It's so cute and cozy! And the coffee is fire! Pictured below is the Spaniard, a condensed milk latte. I think it's $4.75 and totally worth it! It's a great place to study as well! The WiFi is fast and there's plenty of tables to work at. Sit by the window! There are so many dogs that walk by! Especially fluffy ones! I hope to try the pastries next time.
author: Caitlyn S.

description: I went here on a friday afternoon to study with a friend. It is a cute little coffee shop in a busy area of sf. The environment is very good to study or do work in. The place is also uniquely decorated. The baristas were very friendly too. I just ordered a hot tea and was expecting to be able to buy a pastry to go with it but they didn't have any at the time. I think the seating could be more comfortable especially for people who plan to stay here for hours. But overall, it is a good place to hang out and relax on a day off or weekend.
author: Sarah Ann K.

description:
Overall, Snowbird felt like a wannabe of Hollow, transposed from Middle to Inner Sunset. The quaint (and Instagrammable) storefront, dim lighting and abstract music, crafty but disproportionately pricey coffee drinks--the vibes are exactly the same, and perhaps a bit more gentrified. 

I was in the dilemma of wanting to be adventurous but not willing to splurge so much on coffee, so I went with the cafe bombon since it was the cheapest specialty drink. From the description it wasn't clear that it was an espresso shot, so as someone who prefers larger-than-tiny-shot-sized coffee drinks, I was a bit disappointed. I guess it's my fault for not clarifying my expectations, but it seemed like nothing special; just strong coffee made sweet and creamy with condensed milk.... and of course anything tastes good with condensed milk. 

The baristas were friendly and without hipster attitude, and Snowbird is far less pretentious than some of the more extreme hip coffee watering holes of SF. I just didn't find anything special, especially since the ambiance and details felt so oddly identical to Hollow. The wifi and outlets are a plus, but I can't find myself being productive here since the lighting isn't great. 

Sorry, Snowbird! I wanted to get excited about this cute little coffee shop, but at the end of the day I'd rather go to Martha's for its more extensive menu (at better places) and brighter atmosphere.

(Side note: Apparently bombon can mean chocolate or scrumptious girl, and my visit to Snowbird featured neither chocolate nor scrumptiousness.)
author: Edna C.

description:
Delicious coffee, friendly staff, what more can you ask for?
It is a small cafe so sometimes seating might be a little tough, but definitely should get it even to go.
author: M J.

description:
I like this coffee shop a lot. The coffee is very bold and the interior is very hip.  The workers are very friendly. 
It's a good place for chit chat and chilling around as there are a lot of seats at the front and in the back part. People bring their dogs inside, and one of the workers shows the dogs some love with treats. 

I had some time to kill before work and stopped by. I had a cafe bombon. Glad to try it as I like slow sips of rich espresso, and the condensed milk was a pleasant addition. It was different. They have a nice selection of caffeine options as well. 

This coffee shop is worth a visit. It is on par with other coffee shops in the area and a break from Starbucks for some real bold tasting coffee.
author: Jaime F.

description:
Decaf cappuccino, quiet space to work:

I ordered a decaf cappuccino with oat milk and it was delicious. Warm, slightly thick, and creamy, it tasted exactly like the normal caffeinated version. This is important because I can't drink straight coffee anymore since I swore it off this year. Any normal coffee drink makes me nervous (yes literally). This is my new go-to space for a good decaf taste and a quiet space to work.

My one qualm is that the lighting is a little dim for those of us who prefer brighter interiors. I felt a little sleepy after 1.5 hours and went home.
author: Vivian L.

description: a bit pricey..$4.50 for an ice coffee (yikes)! found it to be homey, tho the back was crowded. Pleasant staff
author: Rodger R.

description: Good coffee. Friendly staff and a charming environment - dimly lit and cozy for days.
author: Justin J.

description: The Spaniard is absolutely delicious. A great place to grab a coffee with someone, and nice place to study as well (they only have one outlet though). The service is spot on.
author: Kavya N.

description: Omg love this cute little place! Love it here!!! Small little coffee shop with delish! Love the Chai latte, speciality coffee is extra delish! Five stars above!!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Came here to study. Coffee was alright but I wouldn't go back to study. 

Service: I did not like the girl at the register at all. She didn't greet me and when I asked just 2 questions about drinks she seemed either bored or irritated that I didn't know what to order on my first time here. They weren't even busy (late morning on a weekday). She seemed more than happy to gab with other customers while I was working though so maybe they only care about regulars.. 1/5

Coffee: I ended up getting a cold brew which was pretty good. Nothing special though. They have slightly coffee flavored ice cubes but the end of my drink was pretty sour and watery so I don't think they made that much of a difference. 4/5

Study space: I probably won't come back. The tables stick out really awkwardly from the benches and are tiny circles - the worst kind. Even if you're just there to chat it's tiny and awkward. From pics I thought there were some larger tables but there definitely aren't. Lighting was also horrible - super dim and a really strong yellow tint. I couldn't see my yellow highlighter lol. Bench not that comfortable either. I wore earplugs so noise wasn't a factor for me. 2/5

Overall, I'd be interested in coming to try a specialty drink to just catch up with someone but they didn't make me want to be a regular and didn't like working there very much.
author: Anna N.

description:
Hands down, Snowbird is my favorite coffee shop in the city. They kill it when it comes to quality and service, but more than anything I love Snowbird for its authenticity. In a city filled with pretentious, cookie cutter cafes, Snowbird stands out as a place that cares about their customers and puts genuine effort into creating an all-inclusive, welcoming environment with delicious coffee to boot! 

I've been frequenting Snowbird for over two years now and I seriously feel like family every time I go in; they will remember your drink, your name and even your dog's name (yes, they are dog friendly, even inside!)
author: Chelsey D.

description: Was initially alarmed by the sight of many people using paper cups--a pet peeve of mine when it comes to small coffee houses. The macchiato w raw sugar, however, was rich, velvety, delicious, and had me wanting more!
author: Sylvia C.

description: Accidentally stopped by this place after trying the bakery across the street. Went in because I wanted to try their coffee.  Pretty awesome vibe from this neigbborhood coffeeplace. Comfortable seating with a hipsterish industrial vibe.  The coffee is pretty good and the prices are pretty cheap. Double espress for 2.50 and a macchiato for 3.25.  They also have some pastries which is made by another bakery. Limited options but the almond croissant I had was tasty.  Will likely comeback if I am in the area and want a place to read, work or just relax.
author: Victor J.

description:
Very nice decaf espresso. It's hard to get good crema on decaf and they did it. I thoroughly enjoyed my americano. 

They do charge more for an americano than for the equivalent number of shots of espresso. Clearly other shops do this too but I've always thought it was a bit shady since the only difference is hot water. 

It's bigger than I thought. Not good for a big group but plenty of smaller tables for couples/triples. 

It's a little dark inside but not bad and clean and homey/comfort feeling. 

They were quite quick in producing my americano (but not too quick). On the not cheap side of coffee but I'd recommend it.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Snowbird Coffee sells cheap brew for a coffee roaster. high end pastries available.

 clean, uncluttered small cafe with sunshine lighting. little decor beyond blank walls

brew: batch brew= drip coffee, 16 oz. (2.5)
-smooth brew with streaks of boldness, 
-simple coffee works for me, fancy not in needs book now.

drips:
-small place, easy to miss
-no expectation of privacy, cramp quarters.
author: Victor G.

description: Honest to goodness good coffee here!  Small hole-in-the-wall coffee shop in the Inner Sunset area.  The Cafe Brevano is Yelp worthy plus!  I had to add the wildflower honey and condensed milk because the coffee was legit!  The seating is limited but we were able to walk further down the block for some awesome bakery goodies to go with our coffees!
author: Molly M.

description: Quiet coffee house with small tables suitable for small groups or individuals. I ordered the Spaniard specialty drink (by far one of the best espresso drinks I've had)-must try!
author: Angela M.

description: Super cute and quaint. Classic coffee offerings. Definitely a lovely afternoon spot for whatever type of caffeinated jolt you may be craving. Plenty of outlets!
author: Megan C.

description: Good coffee, cute space, free wifi, gender neutral restroom! Studying in the area in front of the cash register is nice as you get natural lighting. As you travel deeper into the coffee shop, lighting is dimmer and not necessarily that great for studying. Snowbird has a nice selection of unique specialty drinks. There aren't too many coffee shops in the area with free wifi that I know of so this place fits the bill. Would rather come back to just chat and catch up with friends though!
author: Meagan C.

description:
Friend and I went here on Wednesday morning it has the cozy environment. It's very quiet and relax place to have a coffee.
Their coffee is bit strong but you can ask to add more water if needed.
We tried their slice of coffee cake and a muffin which goes really well with the coffee!
author: Sunmin C.

description: I ordered drip coffee and I asked for non dairy milk. The girl that took my order said you will have to pay for non dairy milk next time, but Ill let it go this time. Again, this is drip coffee that perhaps needs just ~2 tablespoons of milk, versus when ordering cappuccino or latte that requires half a cup of milk or more and you will charge me for such a small amount of milk? There are so many coffee shops in the city that this cafe should really reconsider their business strategy.
author: Jasmina T.

description: Cute little coffee shop with great coffee and dim lighting. Nice place to study or do work if you can find a seat. Definitely not a great place for larger groups.
author: Kristine C.

description:
Nestled in the lovely Sunset area, Snowbird is a great little cafe with a curiously curated menu of well crafted coffee. On a gorgeous fall Friday, I was exploring in the area and happened upon Snowbird, and was so glad that I did.

Upon approaching the register, I was met with friendly, patient service with a smile. After inquiring about their various specialty drinks, most of which sounded quite sweet i.e. not my jazz, the barista recommended a cortado with honey: almondy, roasty, a touch of sweetness. Best recommendation ever; I think I found my new favorite espresso beverage. The 6oz drink lets the coffee shine and the honey supplement, milk rounding out the drink with velvety smoothness without drowning out the coffee flavor.

I scored a bean blend bag for $14, roasted only 4 days prior to boot.

Next time I'm in the neighborhood, I will definitely make my way back to Snowbird! Thanks for changing up the espresso game; keep it chilly Snowbird.
author: Shirley V.

description: Not bad. While my iced latte was pretty good, the coffee wasn't great. For the sunset I guess this was better than average.
author: Captain B.

description: Snowbird is a small quiet cafe. There tables are rather small, so if you come with a group to work be prepared to split up. The cafe's seating is limited and I could hear people say to the cashier "I'm trying to see if I should order to go if there isn't any seating." I ordered a mocha, nothing special to me but did do the job :)
author: Mauricia L.

description:
A cute little coffee shop located directly off the N Judah in the Inner Sunset. My fiance and I popped in here on a Saturday afternoon for a little caffeine pick me up while walking around town. A cute and bright little shop with some window seating and little tables towards the back. 

Prices are nice compared to a lot of the shops closer to downtown. It was hot as hell outside so I went for the 1906 Shakerato ($3.50) double shot of espresso shaken over ice and mixed with a bit of sweetner.  My fiance got his usual double shot hot espresso ($2.50) with a sipper of sparkling water on the side.  Service was quick and friendly, we scored some seats up front by the window and enjoyed people watching while enjoying some great coffee.  Unfortunately as it was later in the afternoon there was only 1 pastry left in the case and my fiance said his sparkling water was pretty flat (maybe the bottle had been opened awhile before?) Anyway, would come back here again because they coffee was delicious and smooth - note to self, get here early!
author: Kelsey B.

description: Really love this place. I live up the street so I come here often. The Spaniard is my favorite, but I am a person of habit so I basically order that every time, will try some more and update if needed. The space has gotten bigger since the soap shop closed but still pretty snug. Their cookies are fantastic and the service is great. Highly recommend you stop by if you find yourself in the sunset.
author: Elisa P.

description: Came here for a pick me up, and it did the job. I got the Spaniard which I probably should've known would be pretty milky, but next time I'll probably go with an americano to get a real sampling for how the drinks are here!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Honestly, not impressed.
My friend and I came in today looking for iced tea. Our "greeting" was minimal with no smiles - kinda seemed like we were bothering them since they were deep in conversation. My friend immediately gravitated towards the lavender tea. It was over $3 and when it came out, it looked like water. Instead of tea, it was more lavender infused water, so for $3+ it didnt seem worth it. The girl that brought it over kinda just plopped it down and left. The whole time the two girls just talked to each other, bothered by anything that required their attention.
I didnt know my friend felt the same way until we left, agreeing it was a snotty attitude-filled environment.
author: Shira S.

description: Lattes at Snowbird are consistently good, as is the cold brew - you can tell they put a lot of thought into their creation. It's pretty difficult to find a seat, so I would assume to-go, plus the dim lighting and natural detergent business in the back make it a bit more difficult to feel inclined to stay. Pastries are from Devil's Teeth but they run out fast.
author: Heidi L.

description:
Good place to stop by for a quick cuppa if you're at any of the museums in Golden Gate park and are open to a short walk. 

I was one of half a dozen Girl Scouts parents craving some caffeine after a 'Penguins and Pajamas' overnight event with the troop at the California Academy of Sciences nearby. Around 8 am, kids in tow, we walked the quarter mile to Snowbird in a light drizzle and were politely shown to the inside room, which we had all to ourselves. 

The kids got some sugary treat or other - muffins, scones, coffee cake - all around $3 and served on plates, which made our munchkins feel very grown up. I tried a bit of my daughter's banana berry muffin - freshly baked and delicious. 

The adults got various forms of tea, which we all enjoyed. I had an organic chai ($3.50 for 12 oz.) which was one of the best cups I've had. 

Will visit again for sure if I'm in Golden Gate park and in need of a quality cup of tea or coffee.
author: Navin K.

description:
I'm so glad this is my local coffee shop. The coffee is wonderful, the staff is great, and the price is on point.  Plenty of room inside to sit and do work or hang out with friends.  Also a dog friendly cafe with a nice bench outside for people watching as well.

Reading the negative reviews of this place is absurd.  Girl complains about the lack of greeting and poorly made tea.  It's a coffee shop, your first mistake was not ordering coffee.  Also, I find the staff to be incredibly friendly and chatty, but maybe that's because I frequent this location and am also friendly and chatty?  Also, the iced coffee is amazing.  Person who complained about that must've gone on an off day, because Snowbird's iced coffee set a high bar for my iced coffee expectations (also, coffee ice cubes...)  Girl who ordered the cheapest of the fancy drinks and was disappointed, you should've gone to Starbucks.  All the espresso drinks are phenomenal and delicious, and the proper sized cafe drinks.

Seriously, this is a great coffee shop.
author: Katie S.

description:
Very cute little coffee shop in inner sunset. The staff were extremely nice and helpful with recommendations. Perfect for a few friends to meet up, but not a lot of space for groups. 

I got a poppyseed muffin and the matcha green tea latte. The green tea latte tasted really fresh- not sugary and syrupy like it does at Starbucks. 12oz for about $5- in general everything was a little bit on the pricey side, but the good service, cute decor, and tasty food and drinks make this place 5 stars.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Love the coffee drinks here.  We had the brevana and the spaniard.  both great.  Warm and strong and right next to the GG Park.
author: Trevor P.

description: I can't explain how much I love this place. amazing coffee whether espresso, or pourover. yummy (but pricy) baked goods which they buy from other bakeries, and sweet little spot to work in. Wifi is free, and good amount of seats are available despite it being small. Customer service is good, and efficient.
author: Helia S.

description: Good coffee, good service. My fave is the Brevano with wildflower honey! The baristas and casiers are always friendly.
author: Justine L.

description:
Another hipster coffee place in SF.

However, as hipster coffee goes, it was delicious. We stayed nearby in an AirBnB and were grateful to have good coffee within a couple blocks. We had typical hipster coffee customer service where no eye contact was given and all transactions are done via an iPad. It met expectations and filled a need during our vacation.
author: Jasmyn M.

description: My favorite little coffee shop in the city! My bf and I discovered them after going to the "Coffee" Themed Nightlife at the Academy of Science in GG park. We sampled there drop coffee which was phenomenal and after reading Yelp reviews, we gave them a try. I agree which all of the other reviews that say you absolutely have to try the Bon Bon once! My favorite is the Brevano which has honey in it and is delicious. The shop is adorable with blue painted walls and little seating areas. Very quaint. Love!
author: Alex S.

description:
Easily the coldest I've ever been at a coffee shop, but for a good cause. Door open = handicap accessibility (which is important!!!). But the name is apropos. Worth mentioning. 

I'm a fan of the aesthetic. There are little pinnies and banners around. The interior is tiny, with these little circular tables that jut out of the benches themselves. It forces you to either sit at it alone, with your notebook/laptop, or to only be able to share a table with a fellow coffee/tea drinker. 

The coffee is pretty good. The matcha latte foam tasted too grainy for my liking. Though that may just be a preference factor. I'd recommend this location for anyone who is in the inner sunset, or even traveling there. It's located so close to the N line that you could easily swing by on the way to another engagement. Though that would deprive you of the quirky atmosphere.
author: Nicole C.

description: This is my favorite coffee spot in Inner Sunset. They have excellent cold brew and delicious specialty drinks. Last time I was there, I also got the pecan coffee cake and it was very good. Additionally, it has an awesome vibe inside, wifi, and is a great place to relax and get a bit of work done. Whenever I need a bit of a Kickstarter I stop by this place.
author: Amanda S.

description: Great coffee. My only complaint was that one of then baristas raised her eyebrows at me when I asked for the already brewed drip coffee (which I did because I was in a rush). That being said, I still come here all the time.
author: Yvonne P.

description: A small, cozy cafe tucked in a busy part of SF. My friend and I wanted something to warm ourselves from the cold day and found this cute little place. There isn't much seating, but there are a few tables and benches inside. The decor is unique and homely with books that you can pick up and read. The drinks came out quickly as well and were really well made. The hot chocolate wasn't overly sweet to my liking!
author: Kris C.

description: cute store on 9th and irving in the sunset district.  cool benches and tables, sat down for some hot chocolate after a filling lunch around the neighborhood.  ambiance was nice.  hot chocolate was very mild in taste, could definitely need more chocolate.
author: Linda T.

description:
Based on a cup of 'basic' coffee purchased twice in one day, I'll rate this as 5 stars. A 16 oz. 'batch brew' is $2.50, an absolute bargain for the quality. Though each cup was a couple of hours apart, there was no drop in quality. Most coffee shops do pour over when ordered (my preference) so I was apprehensive. Unfounded. Very good. Will definitely be back whenever!

Small tables are *barely* comfortable for enjoying your coffee, not somewhere I'd go to 'work from home'. No way a laptop and coffee will fit on these little tables.
author: Richard V.

description:
Saturday, 11:30 AM.

Quickie:
+ Drink quality
+ Service
+ Hygiene
- Weak wi-fi
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety
* Layout

And then...?
Nice staff makes good use of limited space. Snowbird Coffee has smooth drinks, go get yours.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Conveniently located along the N Muni line, Snowbird is a treasure in the middle of the Inner Sunset District. This has become one of my favorite coffeeshops not just in the Sunset, but all across San Francisco. The exterior is already eye-catching, and it's similarly visually appealing when you walk inside. There are different types of environments to socialize or work in, including the front area by the cashier and the back room.

The barista was super sweet and helped me select a simple cortado off the menu, which was my first time having it. Next time I'll have to try the other options off their impressive menu of drinks and even their available pastries. Everything  looks and sounds so delicious. I'll definitely be back!!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Snowbird is my favorite place to get a latte in The City! There is this one guy, his milk is off the charts! Every latte I get from him is like silk!! 

They also have the most amazing t-shirts that make fun of Kanye, they say "I like Coffee" and Coffee, Coffee, Coffee, Coffee on the backs in Old English. They are hilarious.

Get yourself to snowbird if you haven't already! They are great for grabbing a latte before the DeYoung Museum, or going into Golden Gate Park.
author: D M.

description: Exactly what this part of the Inner Sunset needed...a friendly, cozy cafe that (unlike the existing cafes on/around 9th) serves well-made espresso drinks, sells beans to go, and isn't a chain, either. Friendly staff, lots of locals, a bench outside and a water bowl for dogs.
author: Mike Y.

description:
I love trying new coffee shops. Snowbird is kind of an old, new coffee shop for me. Located in the old Drip'd Coffee Lab space a couple of years ago, the front of the house received a new facelift, while they're still making soap in the back. The wooden counter gives it a very Californian feel, while the rest of the seating is reminiscent of some of the hipster cafes I've come across in Brooklyn. When I used to live in the Northeast, "snowbirds," were people who flocked south, mainly to Florida, in seek of warmer weather when winter came. Having grown up in the Sunset, there are snowbirds year round in these parts in seek of warmer refuge. Enter this coffee shop.

For coffee aficionados, their specialty selection is the Cafe Bombon, a shot of espresso with condensed milk. It's a simple concoction, which I'm sure would taste more like a Vietnamese iced coffee if it were poured over some cubes. Their latte was standard if you like more milk in your drink. It's always a nice drink to warm you up on a cold San Francisco day. If you fancy cold brews, I highly recommend their bottled cold brew for $4.50. Chug, or enjoy slowly - there's absolutely no acidity. 

The space is a little too small and dim for my liking, but I appreciate the atmosphere. The tables are personal-sized to fit a single laptop so sharing may be an issue. Prime location gives you a stone's throw to Arizmendi Bakery across the street for some fresh pastries or pizza.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
Hip coffee shop. 

Coffee drink prices are average for nice cute shops that are similar. There's free wifi but it was spotty when I was there trying to get some work done. Staff is friendly and I appreciated the free self serve water. 

Small space and slightly dim lighting if you're looking for a solid study spot. But I might be back if I'm hanging around inner sunset and don't want Starbucks.
author: Carissa G.

description:
Cute and innovative with their espressos! 

I stumbled upon this place after getting some Honey Creme down the block. Glanced inside as I was passing by, was intrigued and walked on in. 

Staff was welcoming and friendly. I stared at the menu and noticed the Cafe BomBon was something different. Tried it! And mMMmMMMm, that was a fun explosive concoction of espresso I've never had before. Not going to lie - my tongue took 5 seconds or so to get used to it, but afterwards, I found quite a delight enjoyment in that small little shot. 

Wish I could've spent more time exploring the menu and the ambiance of the place, but at the time, I was obsessed with Pokemon Go and had to continue my Pokemon Journey elsewhere to look for Dragonites. Yes... 

ANYWAYS, I shall be back!!! Excited to learn more about this quirky place! :)
author: Kim N.

description:
My favorite coffee shop in the Sunset! Baristas are all awesome, coffee is delicious, and there's almost never a line. Only downside is that it's not a great place to hang out or work for very long - the bench/table seating is super uncomfortable and tables are too small for a laptop and a coffee. Also, there isn't enough seating - they have extra space but only put a bench instead of more tables.

If I could work here, this would be a 5 star coffee shop for me!
author: Michelle F.

description: Favorite little coffee shop in the inner sunset. The cold brew is great, and every espresso-based drink I have tried has been excellent. Cozy interior and welcoming baristas make it even better. Really nice cafe with amazing coffee and pastries.
author: Rex T.

description: My cousin and I ducked into this place for a pick-me-up on our way to dinner and we were pleasantly surprised. I can't remember the name of what we had... It was the one with wild flower honey in it. It was so smooth and tasted so good we both wound up having two of them. I can't wait to try their other coffee drinks
author: Kero P.

description:
Cool, TINY place. Very small inside and very hipster (which I love). It's dark, not much natural light, but great color scheme and fun wallpaper.

Deliciously made lattes and delightful desserts! Haven't been back since my first (and so far only) visit but do plan on returning. 

Great almond milk latte and almond milk mochas. 

Randomly, they're closed on Tuesdays.
author: Lori T.

description:
Tried the breve with wildflower honey, believe its called the Brevado or Brevano. Drink was the perfect temperature and size, but was extremley thick and rich. Wildflower honey flavor was very subtle. I think this was a tasty drink, but not all would enjoy because the half and half makes it so creamy. 

If i return i will try the cold brew which comes with coffee ice cubes.

Also, pretty cool how they have an organic soap shop in the back. Good variety of products here and a quaint atmosphere.
author: Kimia M.

description:
I'm finally embracing the Sunset. I'm exploring both the outer and inner sunset and finding little gems like Snowbird.

Just hop off the N Judah and strut on in. It's directly across the street from Arizmendi, so if you need a good cup of wake the F up before grabbing a slice then get it here!

I felt like I stepped into an episode of Portlandia. Indoor bicycle parking, standalone shelf with roasted beans, Inner Sunset and Snowbird printed gear...outlets with Apple usb cables coming out of them, mason jars and flowers, hipster barristas.. If that ain't hipster enough for you, the Green 11 ( bring your own container because it's a refill store for soaps, detergent, etc.)  stand in the back portion of the shop should sell ya.

The coffee? Excellent roasts. STRONG. and great service. 

P.S. coffee ice cubes!
author: Susy C.

description:
The Inner Sunset has a ton of coffee shops, but nothing that serves standout expensive hipster coffee like one might expect for this area of SF. Awhile ago, DRIP'D tried and I thought they were doing pretty well, so it was surprising for me to walk over one day and see that it had closed.

Now comes Snowbird, accepting the passed torch with open palms and inheriting this highly coveted spot on 9th & Irving. I have to give them points for a better name and a better use of space. The awkwardness of sharing the area with another business that sells cleaning solutions has been remedied: there's actually plenty of seating and a nice open feeling when you first enter the storefront. The lighting is a little dim for my taste but the hipsters with their Macs and the store's vintage movie posters and succulent-lined shelves make Snowbird strangely appealing. Like, I feel a little cooler just for buying my coffee here.

Unfortunately, the espresso was a letdown. I tried both the Americano and the Cafe Bom Bom (shot of espresso with condensed milk). Both were sour, but the sourness was especially pronounced in the Cafe Bom Bom. I'm sure the coffee beans here are excellent but the roasting method, to me, seems to yield espresso that isn't on par with the quality of the beans. Maybe it's a personal preference or because I'm really just a coffee dilettante who prefers bitter and burnt over under-roasted and sour (and yes, I admit it, I'm a regular Americano-drinker over at Starbucks and Martha's). 

I want to see Snowbird do well and am inclined to give their pour overs and cold brew a try. Expect an updated review soon.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Love this place! I've been a regular since they opened and service and coffee are always both on point.
author: Jessica R.

description: I wanna give it 5 stars but their food/pastry selection is sad and lacking. Good coffee, nice employees, good vibes.
author: Maggie F.

description: Stacy and David are amazing! David made my latte today! Yummy. Love their coffee and shop. I try to make a stop when I am in the neighborhood. Yay, there's a space for me and my laptop today. It's just so cozy, neat, and relaxing there. I like the music selection too. What a Gem in this neighborhood. Will be back!
author: Queenie B.

description:
Tucked away in a side street of Inner Sunset, this cafe also sells natural home products, such as shampoo and cleaning supplies, in bulk. Random, I know. 

It's a very quaint (read: hipster) cafe with lots of small tables, free (albeit slow) WiFi and really good coffee. The shop does get increasingly dark near the back as the only windows are in the front but it's relatively quiet and a good place to focus and get work done.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Great coffee for the neighborhood. Super cute.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I was in the area and was hoping to grab an amazing cup of coffee (per all the great reviews). 
The staff greeted me right when I entered. I quickly looked over the menu and ordered a sweetened latte ($4.25). It was OK. Not served as hot just warm. I get hipsters think milk changes it's flavor at a higher temp and blah blah blah but can I get HOT drink dang it?
Dunno if I'll come back but maybe if I'm in the area.
author: Liz N.

description:
COFFEE AND PASTRIES: 
I ordered the affogato ($4.50). Ice cream and coffee? That is hard to mess up! Their coffee is quite strong here. The ice cream is made in Alameda by a friend of Snowbird called Cookie Bar. It was delicious, but definitely more of a dessert than coffee! I also ordered a croissant ($4). It was nothing special, but it was delicious to dip into my affogato! They sell day old pastries for half off, if that's what you're into!

AMBIANCE:
-Recently opened, so super clean and new. 
-Each table has a vase of fresh flowers! Just don't knock it over...
-Lots of one or two person seating...but not enough for groups of 3+.
-Because they only have one big window in the front, natural lighting is really limited and its a dim yellow inside.
-They have a big open space for bike parking right inside by the door which is nice!

STAFF: 
The cashier was nice, but not very informative or knowledgeable about the coffee. The other baristas were much more helpful when I asked questions after ordering. 

RANDOM FACT: 
There is a speak easy in the back called Green 11 that sells soaps, lotions, detergents, shampoos, etc to people who bring their own containers.

I definitely love these adorable little coffee shoppes, but SF is riddled with them. Each has its own specialty, but I think in order to stand out Snowbird might have to up its game. The price is a bit steep, you can buy a whole meal down the street with that kind of money. But it is comparable to all of the other little coffee places who are also charging exorbitant prices. In the end, its another small cute coffee shoppe with strong yummy coffee for $4 a cup.  4 stars for you Snowbird!

Best of luck, Snowbird! Small local businesses is what SF is all about!
author: Vivian C.

description: Great local coffee shop. Quality pourovers without the pretense. Also really affordable and tasty "batch" coffee $2.50 for 16 oz.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I was visiting for the three-day weekend and my husband and I happened upon this cute little coffee shop. I'm so glad we did! It is conveniently located on 9th so we walked here from our Airbnb on 5th on the way to the farmer's market. 

For a Sunday morning, the place was not too crowded at all. We ordered pretty quickly and the staff was very friendly and gave input when we asked for an opinion. I ordered a latte and lemon bar, my husband got an Americano and the bacon cheddar beer muffin. It was easily the best latte I've ever had and the lemon bar was rich and satisfying. My husband loved his order as well. We were able to sit in the front next to the window and read for about an hour before heading on our way. Awesome atmosphere. 

We loved our first visit so much we had to come back Monday morning before heading home. Again, the line wasn't long and even though the staff was different they were just as friendly. It was a little busier this time around but we were still able to sit and read for an hour or so without it being too crowded or loud. My husband liked my latte so much that he got one of his own today and we both got the bacon cheddar beer muffin (seems different, but so good!). 

We love this place and cannot wait until our next visit to the city so we can return.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Came here with a group of family and friends after exploring the botanic gardens. They forgot to make one of our drinks so we ended up waiting quite a while. I think half the group was happy with what they ordered + the other half was meh. It was a quiet, warm place to sit on a cold spring afternoon but I wouldn't come here often.
author: Annabelle N.

description:
Probably the most adorable little coffee shop I've ever been to ! First impressions upon entering ! Straight to customer service - greetings. The moment I walked through the door I was greeted with  cheers and smiles making me feel extremely welcomed. I took quite the minute to read the menu and decide on my order.  However, not only was I not rushed they asked if there was anything they could clear up for me. The menu isn't complicated at all, I was just a tad indecisive because I was trying a new coffee joint. Not knowing what's good makes it all the harder to order. Also, asking the people who work there could end up with biased opinions. Thank goodness that's not how it is here. Anyways, I decided to go for the cold brew.  

It was a nice big glass or coffee .. Iced with coffee ice cubes. The perfect addition to a cold coffee,... Ice that won't water down your coffee. All coffee drinkers know how that feels, when you pick up your coffee 5-10 minutes later and it tastes nothing like it was in the beginning. The guys here are super nice even as we left. The way they said bye and smiled felt like saying bye to friends.  It's like yeah bye, I'll see you next time. 


And that they will - see me next time because I'll definite be back to try out the other drinks on the menu.
author: Kimm H.

description:
The renovation of this space has been really great...who knew that such a cute and wonderful coffee shop was hiding inside this building? I love what they've done with the space. It's now a great place to sit and do work or catch up with friends. On Sundays they sometimes have live music. Great coffee and great service. I like how they have multiple pourover options and a wide offering of coffee drinks such as affogato! Also great is that they feature not just their own beans but roasts by other great coffee companies. The one downside is that the pastries are kinda sad and dry, but I mentioned it to one of the baristas the other day and it sounds like they're working on changing this. This is my regular Sunday post farmer's market stop. 

Also, they have bike parking inside!
author: Alice H.

description:
Horrible hot chocolate. I told them in a to go cup and then it was for there. Then I had to ask if it could be put in a to go cup and she just added milk to make it fill the cup so now it just tastes like milk. 

Arizmendi does it much better.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Coffee here has the mark of baristas who truly care for their craft, which is an unfortunate rarity. 
It's a shame I only ever come by when I'm in a hurry because this is such a charming little place. If I had an hour to spare, I'd love to spend it here.
author: Izana N.

description: I've had good black coffee from here before but must say I was disappointed with the matcha latte. I had it iced and it practically tasted like a glass of cold milk. I'll keep going to this local spot to try the various coffees they have but I'll have to get my matcha fix elsewhere.
author: Sabrina P.

description: Following the trend in SF, another hipster coffee shop in the inner sunset. Snowbird Coffee is a cute little place tucked away on 9th ave with some great coffee and specialty drinks. I ordered the Matcha Green Tea Latte - which I honestly didn't like very much... I really enjoyed my friend's Brevano - a breve cortado with espresso shot and wildflower honey, it was the perfect balance of sweet and bitter. The cafe itself is relaxing and quiet with plenty of tables to study, work, or hang out. The baristas are very friendly and welcoming. Overall a great place and definitely worth checking out.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I don't write reviews often. 

Decent coffee.

Absolutely terrible service. So rude. Will not return.

Too much good coffee around here to patronize a place where all three employees are going out of their way to make you feel unwelcome.
author: Graham H.

description: The latte art stays well in tact even when you're halfway done with your drink. What more could you ask? Stumbled upon this cafe on a Saturday afternoon. The cute window lettering and two year anniversary sign beckoned me inside. It's very cozy inside and seems to be popular with locals, but not too crowded. I like sitting in the front of the store so I can people watch while drinking my coffee.
author: Connie K.

description: Excellent coffee option. Small and what I consider typical sf style coffee shop. Lighting is good, kind of pre 1940s style seems like. Had the Spaniard which was a great option. Smooth and lightly sweet Spanish coffee style.  Parking is relatively easy for sf.
author: Raúl M.

description:
It's one year later and I paid another visit to Snowbird. As I stated in my first review, i would give the "fan favorite" Cafe Bombon a try. I'm glad I did. :) It's a single shot of espresso topped with condensed milk which is very similar to a strong and bold Vietnamese iced coffee. What makes this better is that it's served in a little cute white ceramic espresso cup paired with a silver spoon. Not to mention, the ambiance of the cafe is cozy and hipster-esque while the employees and fellow customers give out good vibes.

One tip I may include is to check if there are seats available before placing your order. I lucked out and there was only one seat available. :)
author: Briana H.

description: Amazing coffee, and great customer service. I love this coffee shop so much - it became an obsession. Every time I come to the city, I head here. Coffee is that good. And they have the most interesting selections, eg, Spaniard which is latte sweetened with condensed milk. mmmm....highly recommend
author: M M.

description: Meh. Coffee is ok, and overpriced. The service can be hit or miss, there were a few really friendly and quick baristas working there a while ago, lately I see new ones, and they are not friendly at all. Also a "baristas wanted"' sign is on the door. I went there today, and ordered 2 Zatarras, a fancy African blend, which usually takes 5 or 6 minutes, but today I waited like 10 or 15 minutes. Five or seven people who ordered their coffee after me were served and out the door already, and when my order still wasn't ready, I asked the barista about the 2 Zatarras, and she very quickly started making them. No "sorry, it was busy and I forgot", no offer of a free coffee or pastry, and to make a bad scene worse, the quickly prepared Zatarras tasted just like their batch brew. I can find as good coffee with much better service at other cafes nearby, I'll likely not be visiting Snowbird again anytime soon.
author: James P.

description:
I'm usually a little iffy about trying out small, non-chain coffee shops since these places are generally trendy and cliquish to a point of exclusivity. The kind of place where regulars stop conversation for newcomers or stare a little longer than is normal. I just want my coffee and that's all, so places that double as a hangout typically come with a mood and atmosphere I'm not particularly fond of.

Snowbird was a pleasant surprise. Good coffee (ordered a mocha), approachable and efficient staff, diverse crowd, and I even saw a family enjoying themselves in a corner near the front window. No excessive noise. The entire place feels very open and welcoming. My visit was a brief one, but I associate this shop with pleasant thoughts. Would definitely recommend to others.
author: John C.

description:
This is a great little artisan coffee shop right in a little nook on 9th ave. It can be pretty easy to overlook, so make sure you keep your eyes peeled. 

It's beautifully decorated and definitely has that typical "SF hipster" cafe vibe going on. The coffee itself is carefully brewed to order and strong--just how I like it. The pastries are fresh, but was rather limited when I went. 

The space itself, while beautiful, is very small and the tables are even smaller. If you're expecting a cafe to do anything more than catch up with some friends (I.e. Get your Sunday work done), you might have to look elsewhere. The small tables barely fit more than my laptop and the wifi (while free) wasn't the most consistent. 

But as a pure coffee shop--they've got the formula and they're rocking it
author: Jay P.

description:
I adore this charming coffee shop.

Though I stick to their fragrant green coconut tea - rather than their coffee - I would recommend checking this spot out - if you're craving some caffeine in a mellow environment.

The staff are really laid-back and they care that their customers walk away satisfied. If you are unsure of what to order here - I highly recommend checking in with their staff to make sure that you get a hot drink that suits your palate best.

Snowbird Coffee is also a great place to get work done. They have wi-fi and they usually play quality music too.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The man I would later meet up at a party told me about his recent trip to Manhattan where people serving him Blue Bottle Coffee there at Rockefeller Center thought he was a true connoisseur and a true hamster because he has been to to the original Blue Bottles Coffee right at Jack London Square, in Oakland. "But you see, everyone thinks you are the sxxx when you say you are from Oakland." That's true. I've encountered quite a bit of that in the recent travels to Europe and the East Coast. Oakland is very in right now. I tried to impress the man with my recent trip to Omotesando Koffee, aka the coffee zen master in the trendiest part of Tokyo to counter him. But he was only slightly impressed because he's been to Tokyo recently also and had it, as it so happens. Then, just like that, I said, "Have you been to Snowbird Coffee?" 

"Where is that? Idaho?" He asked.

"No, Inner Sunset." I said.

"Oh, the burbs." He replied dismissively.

"Actually, it's not anymore. There are hipster joints too now too in that part of town." A man to the left of me said. 

I was finally saved by the bystander who was going to let me have this one.

I will have you know it's in the December 2014 issue of Zagat, that Snowbird was named as one of the three must try new coffee / pastry shops in this city. And of course I must have the hand-shaken 1906 Shakerato Coffee, which reminds one of Italy, naturally. For my companion, I ordered a cappuccino. They made a heart on the foam, but what I heart the most of it was that they used full fat milk, which my lean, tall friend could use. He makes me look ridiculously fat when I stand next to him. I have considered fatten him up with dollops of butter in his cappuccino, but it would be too cruel of thing to ruin his otherwise perfect coffee. 

The shop itself is very interesting. I would have missed it if it weren't for the fact that it felt like it's sunken in, like the shops you'd see in Germany and Czech Republic. In the back of the shop was a green cleaning product replenishing station. Bring your own bottle and pay only for the refills to save the environment. This type of cohabiting schema is actually quite popular in Portland, and seemingly haphazard. It's like two people who had casual sex, and the woman gets pregnant and decides to keep the miracle baby for she's in her late 30s, and the man decides to move in to co-parent, and a few years later, they have another child via in-vitro just so they could give the first born a sibling. On surface they exist in a functional, peaceful and even loving way, yet their coexistence lacks the apparent logic and substantialism. Which is to say, most of the coparenting couples in the city fit that M.O., or at least among the greater circle of friends of mine. Which is also to say, this shop fits the M.O. of the eclectic city it resides in, and I'd go even one step further to say that this lack of coherence is quite charming and unique, and who knows, it might even catch on by other entrepreneurial businesses. 

I downed my 1906 and walked with my companion across the park (GGP), but not before making a mental note to bring my empty bottles back for some refills while sipping Cafe Bombon the next time I'm in.
author: Victoria E.

description: The only spot in the sunset that does a flat white the right way! Love this place!
author: Gerson K.

description:
Great find. Stumbled across this place on Yelp. Bookmarked it, and finally had the chance to check it out. I ended up spending my whole Sunday here working on various projects. I am not by any means a coffee expert, but I can say that I really enjoyed the cold brew that I got here. As the day went on I eventually gave in and tried the bonbon (espresso with condensed milk). It was interesting and you should definitely try it at least once. Next time I am going to try some of the pastries they offer (because there will definitely be a next time). 

The place is pretty small, but for its size, there was plenty of seating and I was able to find a table towards the back easily. NOTE: the plugs are all towards the tables in the front. Luckily my comp was charged so that wasn't a problem. They have wifi, and the music wasn't too loud and overpowering.  Also, they have some random thing in the back that either sells shampoo or lotion. I'm not quite sure. People would back over there and all seemed to know what they wanted. I was sitting right in front of said space and it didn't bother me at all. The tables towards the back are rather on the small side (but look cool), if you are only using your comp (as I was) it won't be a problem.

A lot of the patrons seemed to know the staff ands questions like "how was the wedding?" or " Hows so-and-so?" which I thought was really cool as well. Oh, and they close at 6, not 7.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Everything about this tiny coffee shop was awesome. I ordered the 1906 something or another - but it was two shots of espresso shaken in ice with simple syrup. It was divine! 

I don't even like espresso. The cups were so adorable and it just felt cool walking in and then continuing to make my boyfriend take a million selfies to capture the memory. 

The baristas were friendly and attentive. 

I recommend this place, FOR SURE! 

Way better than the Beanery down the street.
author: Angelina O.

description: Good quality brew in an upscale(ish) interior. The vibe in this place is hip, ideal for grabbing a cup with a friend to catch up. The lighting isn't ideal for a work cafe, however good ambiance  to just enjoy read the paper. The coffee is served hot and strong with a tad high price tag. If your are in the area craving a craft coffee, I would recommend.
author: Andrew N.

description:
I waited for 10 minutes with my cappuccino to get a table, outside, in the rain. One opened up, I sat down. Within 10 minutes of sitting down I was rushed out by one of the baristas - who walked over and asked if I was ready to get my next drink "because it was getting busy." I apologized and asked if they wanted me to leave or buy something and he just stared at me silently - kind of a weird moment. He repeated that it was getting busy - clearly letting me know that I needed to spend more money or get out. 

I understand the need to do this when there are some customers that set up camp and sit all day at a table after ordering a small coffee. I hate when people do this, it drives me crazy. However, I was there for only a few minutes and the same barista that served me my drink was telling me to buy more or leave. 

So, I got up and purchased an espresso because it was raining hard and it wasn't that busy (nobody was waiting for tables, contrary to what the barista said). 

The coffee was great, but there are plenty of other places that have great coffee that don't rush you out the door like the Snowbird staff. Really disappointed - Snowbird used to be a cool neighborhood coffee place, but now it is turning into another snobby coffee shop.
author: Nick W.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place and am so glad that I made it out to Snowbird after reading up on coffee blogs on what they're doing here.  The have a great assortment of pourover options, and while I didn't get a chance to try their cold brew, I love the bottles they come in! The barista who was behind the till was also great, and was extremely pleasant when I asked for some recommendations on what I like.  After mentioning what I'm drinking these days, I went with their single origin option and absolutely enjoyed it. My husband had the Zatarra, but preferred my coffee more. I love their shop too with all of their slightly hipster but not pretentious vibe.  Next time in the area (Farmer's Market on Sunday/Arizmendi across the street, so obviously I'll be returning) I'll definitely be stopping by here!
author: Lisa I.

description: Minimalist and cute little coffee shop that shares space with a soap laboratory! I found that whimsical and fun (sharing rent price was the real reason behind, as the barista told me when asking if that was part of some sort of marketing strategy). Snowbird coffee has an interesting coffee menu, you can even find the vietnamese type of coffee in here. Pastries wise is not very flamboyant, but I like this type of independent coffee shops and will go back again when in that neighborhood of SF.
author: Carmen V.

description:
Guys, I have become a cold brew addict. Even when the SF winds are making my teeth chatter I often fins myself longing for that smooth java flavor that you only get from that long steeping process. And Snowbird sure does deliver. 

The place is charming as can be, has a trendy hipster type ambiance to it. And really just what Inner Sunset needs. I mean The Beanery isn't terrible and you have a few other cafes to choose from but stop at Snowbirds!

The barista (I think the manager?) was super sweet and gave me a first timer discount. And of course I ordered the cold brew. The coffee ice cubes are genius! Your coffee stays flavorful the whole time you're drinking it. Strong work, Snowbird. Keep it up.
author: Miriam M.

description:
Stopped in here to see why people love it so much.
We ordered the Spaniard and a Cafecito.
Delicious!
The drinks were sweet and tasty and had a very pretty design on the top. The atmosphere was relaxed and chill (lots of people were working on their computers, etc.).

I would go back!
author: Rachel M.

description:
We were staying nearby this coffee shop during our visit to SF and I'm so glad we were able to try their coffee. They have a short and sweet menu which makes it easy to make a choice. I tried two of their latte's and they were both delicious. 

The staff is friendly and recommended some options to try. They always made a pretty design on top of the foam giving it a nice personal touch.
The seating is great to have your morning coffee alone or with a companion, there isn't much space. 

We were hooked and would get up every morning to go get our latte's. Honestly, I still crave it and it was the highlight of my mornings while staying in SF. I hope to go back soon to get my snowbird fix!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Love this place. And it gets better with every visit.

What to look forward to: 
* delicious, quality azz coffee.
* friendly atmosphere -- customers + baristas alike
* community feel
* in need of soap, shampoo, or good smellies? They got a great bulk shop in the back corner

I really love this place!!! I ordered from the small lot coffee menu and wow, my coffee tasted nutty. Just the way I like it. I also had great conversation with the barista, Leon, as well as some locals who welcomed me to the neighborhood.

Highly recommended!!!! Come here for delicious brews, drinks, tea, and sweet treats...and good smells.
author: Bern M.

description:
Decent coffee shop in sunset district, probably one of my favorites in this area behind Andytown.  The spaniard latte is good, i highly recommend!  How can you go wrong with espresso, milk, and condensed milk right?  The latte was average, too much milk made it very light.  

Inside seating is a little odd, their are tables and chairs, but the desk are very small and hard to study.  This place gets surprisingly packed, probably because its one of the few which serves legit espresso.  They also serve goodies from Devil's teeth bakery; so if you dont want to trek to the boonies for Devil's teeth, you can come here!  But darn, they do no serve their famous breakfast sandwiches.
author: Terence N.

description:
That cold brew though....oooo eeEEE!!! 

Been wanting to go here for a long time but for some reason never had. Got the cold brew iced coffee. Mind blowing good. I usually add a little bit of milk, no sugar. It was damn good. I can't tell if I got the cubes of coffee but my drink doesn't look or taste watered down so I am thinking its standard. Either way, it was damn good. May need to make a few block detour on my way to work a few days a week. 

Looking forward to trying some espresso and other things. Also the place is cool looking. Nice window light. May need to find some time to chill there and snap some photos.
author: Benjamin W.

description: Fast service that is eco friendly. Coffee is also very good. I had a latte and I was a fan. I have also tried the chai latte which I found very refreshing. The chai latte is more on the sweet- cinnamon side, but I really liked it and would get it again.
author: Lynn T.

description: I'm no coffee connoisseur, so take my review with a grain of salt, but I really enjoyed the cold brew I bought here this morning.  Strong, but not bitter at all.  Plus they use frozen coffee for the ice cubes, so it doesn't get diluted as they melt.  My girlfriend who IS a tea connoisseur loved her cup of Earl Grey.  Nice space, staff seemed friendly, and our order was ready in no time.
author: Joshua W.

description:
I asked If I could change my drink and the baristas said it would be to complicated...they weren't even busy and they had 3/or 4 baristas working. 
The coffee is over priced and the customer service is lacking.
author: Zeba A.

description:
Found out through Yelp and it so happened to be on my way to a weekend meeting.  I'm more of a tea/tea latte gal so when I saw they started selling green tea lattes, I was on it stat.  $4.50, $4.75 for a small 4 - 6 oz. cup of latte is expensive, but I'm guessing that's expected in a hipster coffee shop.   For what it's worth, the latte art is a redeeming factor to its steep price point.  Cute coffee shop, but it's located on a non-so-trendy block of Judah St (Donut World & Cybelle's Front Room Pizza are directly across).  At least Arizmendi is around the corner so one can grab a cup of joe and a tasty slice before heading off.  

It's back to Peet's for my green tea latte.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Me: Hi, I'd like to order a double espresso over ice.
Lady at register: Ok sure!
Me: Would you mind putting it in a large cup? 
Lady at register: No, that would be an iced latte.
Me: Oh, I don't want *that* much milk, I just like to add a drop of milk to my iced espresso.
Lady at register: No, that would be an iced latte.
Me: Uhm, it's not like I'm gonna fill up the milk all the way to the top, if that's your concern.
Lady at register: ***literally just stares me down without saying a word***
Me: You know what, forget it, give me the tiny cup.

Date: Sep 17
Time: 2pm ish

Conclusion: don't go to Snowbird on Saturday afternoons, or you're gonna get a staredown for voicing your easily-accommodate-able request... no room for compromise I guess, and no desire to deliver an ounce of customer service. Or you might be shunned for adding too much milk to your iced espresso?! I felt **really** conscience of how much milk I was gonna add to my espresso after that... should I really feel this way at a coffee shop... ? Did the lady **really** think I was going to "steal" her milk after asking for a slightly larger cup? God knows. 

Always thought the coffee was decent here, a 3rd wave type of taste. But don't expect the employees to value your business...or you.
author: Max G.

description:
I loved the coffeeshop before this too, but this is a better use of the space. You don't have to walk past a counter for soap refills before getting to the coffee. The coffee game is strong, and the baristas are super sweet.

I wish they had some more seating, because I've walked in, seen that all the seats were taken, and had to take my laptop (and business) down the street.
author: Vivian H.

description:
This is a super cute coffee shop with adorable little round tables. I really like the decor and the staff were really nice.

However, the coffee was just meh. I tried both the cafe bombon and a regular almond milk latte. Maybe I expected something really amazing based on the other yelpers, but I didn't feel the 'wow' factor. Lattes are usually my go-to coffee drink and the one i tried here was mediocre.

Maybe i'll come back and try it again. But with so many other places to try in SF, i probably won't be back anytime soon unless i was in the 'hood.
author: Jenny M.

description: Pretty nice place. SO and I stopped by on a weekend afternoon looking for a snack break, and were pleasantly surprised by this place. It's a cute little cafe, albeit a bit small, but nice, and has decent coffee. They have a few specialities -- notably the Cafe Bombon, an espresso over a bed of condensed milk. Pretty good vibe, and def a nice local hangout. Would probably stop by this place more if I lived in the area.
author: Jasmine X.

description: I stop by every time I'm in San Fran. The baristas are knowledgeable and answer any questions about the specialty coffees. This is definitely a spot to get coffee. Snacks and seating are limited.
author: Christina L.

description: I have been wanting to try this place out for a while, but sadly was disappointed. The interior is really cute and seems like a nice place to study in the afternoon but I wouldn't recommend their matcha latte. It tasted like milk with a little bit of matcha flavoring, not strong at all. ):
author: Stephany L.

description: I drove 35 miles every day for a month to get a latte from Snowbird. Granted, I was driving into work from Fremont, but that small truth aside, this is the best damn latte I have ever had. Ever. The coffee: regal and rich, with complex notes of earth and nut, and roasted to angelic perfection. The foam of the latte is so thick and luscious that it never settles. Nay, it clings to the sides of the mug, daring you to slurp at it, to suck in every last micro bubble. And you should. The ambiance is perfect, like a comfy nest that lets your stress evaporate and ushers in creative energy. Ever since I started at a new job, midday coffee is not the same. I miss you, Snowbird.
author: Michael B.

description: Do yourself a favor...try the SPANIARD! Delightful spot. Love the ambience and little details of the potted plants on the walls and floating tables.
author: Taylor M.

description: I came here with a friend and was surprised how much I loved this place. I got an almond milk matcha latte instead of an espresso drink - it was great! I was nervous about the almond milk plus matcha mix, but I thought the milk was foamed perfectly, and the matcha flavor came through really well. I had a sip of my friend's coffee, and it was also really good. I think this is definitely one of my top coffee places in the city.
author: Steph V.

description: Today,  big road construction is happening on the local streets. There is a parking lot nearby.  Access the lot so you can enjoy this crazy Friday morning. Snowbird Coffee is a neighborhood favorite.  Some people come here for the fresh kaufee. Some are here for a beverage and Internet access. I think a few people ate here to be seen.
author: The Adv G.

description:
A quaint coffee shop opens right outside my girlfriend's door is literally a dream come true. The former liquid refills/supplies store moved to the back of the renovated, elongated space fronted by a coffee bar with adequate seating to the right. It's like a bigger Hollow (the one down Irving), and that's not a bad thing at all.

Try the cafe bombon (espresso with condensed milk) -- it's amazing.
author: Jonathan C.

description: The baristas are pretty kind here and the music in the cafe is quite decent. The coffee is good and it's a good local go to place to get some work done. There's not that much seating, but I have been able to get a seat every time I go. There's not a place like this in the inner sunset like this, which is why I even like it more. :)
author: Julie L.

description: Yum! Came here with a date and ordered an almond milk latte and the special Breve Cortado with Wildflower honey.  Both were delicious. I really like the Wildflower honey.  Tasty!  Didn't stay to drink the beverages but the place looked cute.
author: Monica J.

description:
I admit to being a total coffee snob, and I absolutely love this place! I am a year-round iced coffee drinker, so their coffee ice cubes have won my heart. Plus, of course, their delicious coffee beans. 

Great service with friendly, knowledgeable baristas. Adorable cafe with lots of seating for work or just to hang out.
author: Eunice K.

description:
Yummy! 
Enjoyed my Breve cortado with wildflower honey.
The little bit of sweetness was a nice touch.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Snowbird Coffee is a gem on 9th Avenue; even though it has lots of competition in the area, it still stands out as one of the best coffee shops in the area. With a large variety of coffee drinks, from pourovers to coffee to unique drinks such as the shakerato and brevano, customers have a good selection to choose from. So far, I have tried the pourover, brevano and cold brew. Even though the pourover and cold brew are delicious, the brevano is the star of the show. A mixture of an espresso shot and wildflower honey, the six ounce drink is smaller but the subtle sweetness is a pleasant surprise and contrast from all of the much more sugary sweeteners out there such as vanilla, hazelnut, etc. It is a perfect balance of sweet and bitter, and I always come back for the brevano now. 

The environment of the cafe is also relaxing, quiet, and an escape of sorts. A couple desks sit in the front of the shop, with some more in the back for doing work. Even though the lighting is a bit darker, it is a nice escape from the more hectic city environment around the area and is very conducive for doing work. I always come back to Snowbird for unique coffee and coffee beans to take home for my French press.
author: Annie C.

description: Super fast and fantastic coffee. I'm a bit of a coffee snob and they had a great house roast. Friendly service and cool joint to work or read in
author: Rio S.

description: Such a cute cafe! I came here with a friend for a little bit of studying on Sunday and we ordered the matcha latte and chai latte! Both were really delicious and creamy! I would definitely come back to try their other drinks, but probably not to study as there was only one outlet (that I saw, anyways). They do have free wifi here though, so that's convenient! Staff is also super friendly. If you're in the area, definitely check Snowbird out!
author: Trisha V.

description:
Kinda nervous about giving this place a good review as it means it'll become more popular. It's great to have coffee of this quality in the neighborhood. The space itself is a great place to come and sit/read/drink for a while. It can get crowded...but if it does, take the coffee to go and sit in the parklet outside arizmendi - hopefully the parklet outside snowbird takes off so there will be some outside space to enjoy their coffee. 

The only thing that doesn't make too much sense is the detergent store in the back. It takes up valuable real estate that could be better used with seating.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Bought a black coffee. By the time I got to my car 30 feet from the front door, the paper cup and plastic lid had become so soft and deformed from the ridiculously hot coffee that the lid popped off and the atomic hot coffee began to spill all over me and my car. I went to take the coffee back with the intention of asking for a new cup and maybe a few cubes of ice. Along the way the paper cup began to peel apart and more atomic hot coffee began to spill on my hands. When I finally made it back to the counter, I began to tell the guy about the situation, to which he responded "hold on a second, bro" and then BEGAN making an espresso drink. 

Keep your coffee, keep the $2.50. It's the last penny you'll ever get from me. Anyone that serves coffee that hot obviously doesn't know anything about coffee.
author: Francisco S.

description:
I'm going to say it: this is the best coffee in San Francisco. I am a FREQUENT Philz, Illy, Blue Bottle, name-another-specialty-coffee-from-another-city drinker, and as the current Duchess of Snowbird I feel like I can say this with authority. It's a small shop that knows what they are doing, and haven't lost their quality due to expansion. It's the perfect fit for the community-focused neighborhood that is the Inner Suset.

In terms of atmosphere, this place is hipster to the extreme -- there is a booth in the back where you can refill your empty bottles of laundry, soap, etc. 

Rating coffee alone, Snowbird definitely gets 5+ stars. That said, to set expectations, there is somewhat limited seating, no back patio (though a couple tables out front), and because it is hand-crafted (I know, I know, but it's a small shop so there's literally one cashier and maybe 2 baristas at a given time), the wait during rush hour in the morning can be 10 minutes. There are some small bites (scones, etc), but coffee is what this place is all about.
author: Ashley P.

description: I honestly think they have the best coffee in the sunset area! Definitely make a trip to try their pour over coffees. It's created with 5 minutes of love and care and it tastes perfect.
author: Becky M.

description:
My favorite cafe in the neighborhood--I might just be addicted to their coffee and nothing else. 

COFFEE: Great baristas who take coffee seriously. I've never had a bad cup here. The special offerings (like the shakeratos) are amazing.
