UTILITIES: Plenty of seats with a few power outlets, free wifi, and a small bathroom for customers. Easy credit card payments with Clover.

AMBIANCE: Relaxed and chill. It is a little dark in the back but still comfortable. 

CONS: The only improvement I would suggest is more pastry offerings. They often sell out by mid-afternoon.
author: River S.

description:
Good coffee coffee, cozy cafe. Slightly awkward layout.  They have a pop ups store in front and a soap store in the back. I think they are wasting the prime window seating in front and back and would be better off with more light and more  comfortable seating, perhaps a laptop bar

Overall it feels a little like squatting in someone s basement workshop
Slightly jarring 50 s music was playing and there were a couple of employees chatting up front

The barista was nice and brought my latte to my table 

I think the place has potential but is a little rough around the edges. Overall a nice addition to the  neighborhood
author: W M.

description: Cute local coffee spot.  Staff were friendly. Cold brew was better than most, mellow and not overbearing .  No need for added sweeteners or cream.  Pricing affordable.  Better option than going to Starbucks.
author: Danielle M.

description: I love Snowbird coffee! This was on my block, so I got a chance to stop in every morning before work. They offer great coffee, small pastries, and have very pleasant staff. They tried their best to get to know their neighbors beyond pleasantries; when my friend moved away they made her cookies--so sweet and like them!
author: Lina R.

description: Update..after going to a few coffee shops in the city. $3.25-$4 is the average price for a cappuccino. Obsessions get you poor. Anyway. I still think snowbird is better than the beanery nearby.  I really enjoy the quaint space and friendly staff.
author: Katie T.

description: This is my favorite coffee spot, a place is cozy and inviting that I can escape form everything else for a moment with the exclusively crafted drinks and greeted with friendly servers!  Genius and superb!
author: Fred L.

description:
I've been here many times, and unfortunately I always leave a little disappointed.  I recently had a pourover and a pain au chocolat, and it came to $8.  I guess that's the going rate in SF these days, but it really just made wonder if I was getting an $8 experience.  The pourover was significantly smaller than those from Philz, and frankly it was rather bitter and watery.  The pain au chocolat lacked character and tasted like it was from an industrial bakery.  They were selling beans from Denver's Huckleberry Roasters for $24.40 a pound.  Seems steep.  I don't think there's anything better in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't say this is a destination coffee shop like Philz, Four Barrel, Blue Bottle, Ritual, or Sightglass.

It's also very annoying that the floor has a slight bump near the area with the lids, milk, and sugar.  If you're walking to the back of the shop with a full cup of coffee, it's easy to stumble and spill your drink.  It's not Snowbird's fault, so I'm not holding it against them, but it's still annoying.

*** August 2016 update... I'm happy to report that the pastries have gotten much better.  They've partnered with Devil's Teeth Baking Company.  However, the pourovers remain a disappointment.  You're better off with an espresso drink.
author: Lucullus L.

description: Try the "Brevano", it's delicious. It has a very interesting mix of sweet (honey) and espresso flavors. Snowbird is a charming coffee shop with a helpful staff, one of the best in SF. Prices are great too. Snowbird is a quick walk from Golden Gate park and great place to relax after a long day.
author: Alex M.

description: Snowbird is one of my favorite coffee spots in the city. Their coffee is damn good :) the location is in pretty good area, there is a lot of restaurants around! I would totally recommend that place for "coffee lovers".
author: Kuba T.

description:
I finally got a chance to stop by here last weekend. Great location. The guy behind the counter was super nice, so +1. 

Unfortunately the coffee was harsh and nasty. I got an americano, which I drink black no sugar. My girlfriend just got a brew. I don't know if it was over-extracted or what. Both cups tasted like they came out of a pot that was sitting on a burner all day long. 

Maybe it was a one-time quirk. I'd love to give this place another try and change my rating, but would rather go down the street to Hollow, which is consistently good. I guess I'll have to suck it up and try Snowbird again one day, but not any time soon. 

Oh, to the yelper who said, "This is the most hipster place in the Sunset," you must not have tried Trouble on Judah?
author: Tom P.

description: Such an amazing coffee!! I was waiting in the crowded Starbucks, then I decided to go Snowbird Coffee.. Smaller place, friendly staff and a delicious warm milk for $2. I come here every friday during my laundry. Nice place!
author: Lino M.

description:
Good coffee drinks and tea, I particularly enjoyed their coconut infused? green tea which is a great hangover remedy. I don't visit as often as I do with other cafés because they just don't have enough seating optimal for conversation. I personally also find it weird that they are sharing the space with a soap/oil/body care company. Don't get me wrong, I love the idea of co-sharing spaces. But it just seems a little odd when I take a sip of my cappuccino and smell soup at the same time. Maybe it's just my sensitive olfactory neurons. 

Anyway, it's a great pit stop for good coffee in that part of the sunset, but I wouldn't stay for long.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Absolutely my favorite neighborhood coffee shop.
It's everything a coffee shop should be. Comfortable vibe, quiet, amazing coffee made with craft and passion. I love walking in and feeling at home, and being known by name.
My favorite drink is the Cold Brew. Some of the very best I've had in San Francisco. The Shakerato is also on point. I feel lucky to have Snowbird coffee in my neighborhood.
author: Kelly R.

description:
So...I do enjoy the Brevano. A lot. Rich, bold flavor with a hint of sweet and none of that burnt taste that ruins a good espresso drink. 
But why are you so expensive?! At 4.50 a (small) cup, I can only enjoy you when I'm feeling splurge-y or if Arizmendj is closed. 

I want to give you more stars because I enjoy you, but you're really too expensive.
author: Hanster P.

description: Great espresso but no soy milk :(  Service was friendly. The interior is thoughtful, nice color pallet, especially the wall paper. It's a bit cavey = low ceilings and narrow.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Favorite coffee shop hands down!!!!! If you like strong coffee.... this is your spot  friendly staff as well!
author: Christina S.

description: Love their lattes! Smooth and creamy and pretty. Great local coffee shop with a cozy interior. Wish I had one closer to my house!
author: D K.

description: Really?!  .75 to add some non-dairy milk into my already $2 8oz batch coffee?! For those of us who can't drink dairy, I find this to be some extreme bull $hit. Once again it's evident how natives are continuously out priced here in our hometown. Also, the barista looked like she wanted to choke me when I asked for non-dairy milk.
author: Lou D.

description: Cute, small coffee shop. Small being the key word, the very limited seating. However, the coffee was good and the staff was friendly. If your lucky enough to get seating, it's a nice place to relax or catch up with a friend.
author: Allyson A.

description:
Got a latte and it was piping hot. (This is a good thing for me, since lukewarm and fresh made coffee just seems counterintuitive.) Cute interior and small seating area against the wall on a bench. No many laptop squatters, so people flow in and out, just enjoying coffee and quick conversation. Good roast, but doesn't make you jittery. 

3 guys working there were having fun and enjoying work (but not goofing around), which is something I always look for in a business. Happy employees tell you a lot about the company/business, no? Kind guys, definitely not pretentious when you're staring at the menu, not knowing your coffee lingo. They're happy to help. :)

Tried the Cafe Bombon last time, which is an espresso with condensed milk. If it's your first time trying it, don't forget to stir first, or else you get a shot of espresso and you're scraping the condensed milk off the bottom of your cup after...

One of my favorite local coffee shops. Love that it's close to GGPark too! :)
author: Ann L.

description: Super cute cafe on 9th between Irving and Judah. Serves up great coffee and has scrumptious looking pastries. I love the seats on the inside. Great place to grab a quick coffee or to stay to lounge.
author: Sherry L.

description: I was looking for a place to read some chapter of novel... Loved there coffee and decoration. Small round table doesn't make me feel lonely when i go there alone.. Really like this place :) will go back for some coffee ice ..
author: Nichapatr P.

description:
Nice and friendly staff! Very clean and clear menu. I'm not a huge coffee drinker but they have a variety of different coffee drinks. I had the mocha and it was good to have something different than Starbucks. The mocha is less sweet but full of flavor. I also had it iced. The girlfriend had a latte and it was also on point. 

They also have outlets for you to charge your phone, cords are even provided!!
author: Benjamin C.

description:
One of the most relaxing coffee shops in the Inner Sunset. Great coffee, people and atmosphere. WIll keep coming back! It's a new favorite spot of mine. 

They have wifi and plugs! They also provide a complimentary cord to charge your iphone. Finally a place that doesn't want you to drink your coffee and leave immediately.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
The QUAINTEST coffee shop I've been to in quite some time. The coffee is excellent the staff is warm and friendly and the pastries are baked fresh every morning. The atmosphere is so inviting you never want to leave. What more could you ask for? Oh yes, a killer music selection! They've got that too. 

LOVE Snowbird Coffee!
author: Shauntee E.

description: This is my neighborhood coffee shop/boutique natural soap shop in the back room.  I'm here several times a week for an espresso pick me up - affordable, reliable and friendly folks behind the counter every single visit.  Always wearing their cool branded tee shirt and always tempted to buy more of their swag.  This place is a hipsters coffee shop w/out a million people lounging around all day using the WiFi - which is the way we all hope it stays!
author: Daniel C.

description: Good coffee, but charging for non-dairy creamer in your cup of Joe is not chill. Next
author: Candace C.

description:
Snowbird coffee is fancy coffee. Do not expect it to be a fast pace coffee shop like Starbucks or Peets. They brew each cup to order (pour overs) and have other selection on their menu as well.

They only have one size (12 oz.) depending on the type of drink you're getting. A latte would be 12oz. I'm a big coffee drinker who don't just drink for the caffeine, but I usually drink a large cup a day. For those who drink coffee for a boost to wake up, they definitely have bold, delicious coffee. For those of you who drinks coffee for the flavor and wants more than just a small cup, this is not the place for you. Price range around $4+ for all 12oz. However, it indeed is a good cup of joe.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Was excited to give Snowbird Coffee a try as its recently opened and I'm always gitty about new cafes in the westside of SF.  

The cafe replaced Drip'd. Small space but cute. The cashier was friendly and provided additional info on some of the drinks on the menu that I was not familiar with. 

I ordered the Bravno which is espresso and less milk than a regular latte. At first sip inside the cute cafe, the drink tastes great. Walked back to my car, drove several blocks, took another sip and immediately the drink was no longer hot. Luke warm to say the least. I like my coffee hot! The espresso taste wasn't strong enough towards end of the cup as well. 

Don't think I'll trek over here unless I'm already in the neighborhood and perhaps ask for extra hot next time around.
author: Dee T.

description:
I can't tell you how happy I am that a REAL coffee shop has opened in my neighborhood. Typically, you can only find establishments like this in the Mission, but not any more!

Snowbird just continues to delight, with knowledgeable and UNPRETENTIOUS barristas, very well thought out design / ambiance and top notch coffee / tea. I am an iced coffee freak, and they actually use coffee ice cubes (actual frozen coffee) that takes a lot longer to freeze, but serves to prevent the iced coffee from getting diluted with water. I mean, any place that does this is ok in my book... it's the little details that matter in any establishment like Snowbird, and the natural, honest quality that you get at Snowbird is simply awesome.

I would give Snowbird 10 stars if I could... good luck guys!
author: Jeremy F.

description:
Cool hipster place for coffee and it's close by.  I love the mason jar decorations and the latte art is pretty pretty cool.  I won't say this is my favorite place for coffee, but it's pretty good and the art just makes it that much better. 

Not much seating, but it's definitely a quaint place to read, study, work, or just relax. Plus the latte art is always nice for those Instagram photos... (which I'm totally guilty of doing)
author: Steph S.

description: Remind me to thank my employer for sending me to this pretty fantastic place (again). Well, not Snowbird directly but they at least got me to the city. You walk into the (somewhat) narrow space and are immediately greeted with warmth. My girl ordered a latte while I tasted their freshly brewed coffee. Neither of us were disappointed, while I was genuinely impressed with the strength and depth of the coffee. Prices were the norm, plenty of reading material (especially if 40 year old newspapers are your thing). Pro tip: Go to the very back and reward yourself with some of the most comfortable chairs in the history of coffee shops. Will be back.
author: Eric W.

description:
I just want an Americano with Hazelnut. No flavors, they say, just almond milk and simple syrup. 

I just wanted to support a new local business and I like what I like,  I won't be back.
author: Frankee C.

description:
14.12.01         First Visit
                       Opened in 2 months

Coffee --------------------------------------- 4 to 4 1/2

Basically a hollowed up garage.
They should upgrade the seating and interior

Snowbird Coffee 
Ruby Roaster Colorful Coffee

Had the Iced Coffee with ice cube made of coffee.
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Almost there. 

I love the layout, half industrial, half cozy neighborhood coffee shop. The actual coffee needs some work still. Their espresso drinks are awesome, cappuccino was one of the best I've had. Their pour over, however, was lacking and was completely watered down. Not sure what kind of water:coffee ratio their baristas are using, but it just didn't work this time. I'll definitely be back to give them another chance though. 

Oh, and the creepy lotion and shampoo store is now in the back of the store. I'm quite certain all of Irving's property values just went up with this change in layout.
author: Mattheus K.

description:
I stopped in recently when I was looking for a great latte in the Inner Sunset and the line at Arizmendi was stretched out the door. I am glad that I mixed up my routine, because the latte that I had from Snowbird is definitely the best I have had in the neighborhood and among my top three in SF. 

My only wish is for more outdoor seating, as it was beautiful outside the morning I stopped in and I did not want to sit inside because most of the good seating was taken. There were a few seats in the very back of the space at a high table surrounded by what looked like bottles of chemicals. I just was not into the basement vibe it had going on. There were many people camped out with their laptops, for what it's worth.
author: Patricia D.

description:
So I took my 2 young boys in there this chilly afternoon for some hot cocoa.  At $3.50 a pop, I was interested to see how it was?

When the first one was done, I picked it up to hand it to my boy, but it was not warm to the touch.  I dipped my finger in, and it was still cold. I quickly alerted the barrista to this, and instead of an apology, he looked a little irked, and told me that next time I need to ask for "extra hot."  I did a mea culpa as he started a new one, and I asked him nicely to make it as hot as a regular coffee.  After all, he does have a milk steamer and can make it super-hot if he likes.

So ... after all this he did finish the 2 cocoas, and they were room temperature. I was afraid to even tell him about this after how bothered he was after the first round.  My boys got about 1/2 a block down 9th before they ended up dumping the drinks  down a stormdrain.  Cold cocoa just isn't good.

What could have gone better:

1) Never make room temperature cocoa when someone orders hot cocoa.  Kids or not, no one likes tepid cocoa.
2) When a customer has an issue with a product, don't make them feel guilty.
3) Make it right the 2nd time.

Blew nearly $8 and my kids never warmed up.
author: Rob L.

description:
It really is all about the coffee here. You can tell by the aroma and by the attention to detail by the staff that they love coffee and take the matter seriously. I haven't even begun to delve into the possibilities offered by their menu.

Everyone who works in the place is customer oriented and will answer all your questions. Each cup you order is hand crafted. There's no assembly line here.

Park your bike just inside, or check for parking in the lot just around the corner. And of course the Muni will bring you within a few feet of the place.
author: Vincent L.

description:
This place has great quality strong coffee. It's really smooth, no strong bitter after taste. For their milk drinks they only have whole or almond. A 2% option would be nice for peeps watching their calories. 
But anyways, so nice to have such a great coffee shop in the neighborhood.
author: Kirsten F.

description: The baristas here are the sweetest! They where super chill with this lady that was nonstop talking.
author: Mimi H.

description:
Legitimate cappuccino.  One of only a handful of places that integrate the frothed milk into the espresso instead of just putting a dollop of foamed milk on top.

Very caffeinated but light and airy while consuming.  It's a great alternative if you want to avoid the Mission.  Best place for coffee in my opinion for Inner Sunset.
author: Kevin H.

description: First time @ Snowbird. Great specialty coffee shop featuring their own roasted plus a rotating outsourced roaster. They have coffee dialed in. Recommend.
author: James S.

description:
Cute, good drip coffee but have not tried the expresso drinks they are known for yet.

Great ambienance/decor and very friendly staff.
author: Tim A.

description: Great coffee shop with a cute interior. Had a chai latte and it was one of the best I've had. Would recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Chris F.

description:
This place is super adorable! It replaced Drip'd and the eco refill place has moved to the back. It's spacious and has plenty of seating for people who want to work (wifi-available) or just chill. I love all their attention to detail and their coffee is quite nice too. I tried the latte with almond milk and it was smooth and rich, I'll soon be back for the bonbom- espresso with a little bit of condensed milk.

Service is lovely and helpful as well
author: Kate M.

description: Very happy to have this excellent coffee shop in my hood. Everything is well done from the drinks, to the unique to the shop drinks, to the shirts and pendants. Yes, pendants. A nice, dark, cozy place to hang out. You can even refill your liquid home needs from shampoo to uh, whatever else with the small shop in the back (green 11). The aromas kind of fight, flavorful coffee with scented liquids, but it is okay.
author: E. W.

description: This spot is great! Really cool space, beautifully decorated (every time I'm in here I notice another little detail that I obsess over) Also it's in the neighborhood and the feel of the space definitely echoes that. Coffee is roasted in house at their roastery (is that a word?) in East Oakland I believe and staff is the perfect mix of friendly, quiet and intuitive... Nothing like those smacked out weirdos at Starbucks.
author: B W.

description:
Came here looking for a place to study. Quiet shop with bench seating along the wall and small tables coming out of the seat, big enough for a 15' laptop, maybe even a 17'.

I didn't see any plugs around, but they do have Wifi available.

The staff of 2 were very friendly and stroke up conversations with many of their customers. 

I got the chai tea which was good, but I regret not getting one of their expresso drinks. Just ask them what they recommend or have them explain to you what they have.
author: Michael S.

description:
Good coffee and cool vibe. 
Hipster baristas are a plus, because I've noticed a strong correlation between how hipster/trendy the baristas look and how good the coffee is.
If the baristas look like minimum wage low-income housing dwellers, the coffee tends not to be good.
author: Toro O.

description: Cool trendy spot for coffee. I ordered a green tea latte, which was alright. BUT it took 20 minutes. Insane! It might have just been an outlier but still ridiculous.
author: Ashley P.

description: This is undoubtedly the best coffee in the Inner Sunset. Don't let the moody ambiance and unusual menu items deter you - this place is anything but pretentious and the baristas have been welcoming and conversational every single time I've visited. I order the Brevano and cold brew pretty frequently, and occasionally the matcha latte. The combination of ambiance, no line out the door and carefully crafted coffee makes this my go-to place for productive coffee sessions.
author: Caroline W.

description:
Great location and very friendly staff. Parking located nearby the coffee shop is very convenient. Daily fresh pastries and excellent coffee . Very cute interior, you can also buy green product soap in the back of the shop. 
Good coffee selection and fine coffee taste, perfect to the touch and not too acidic as some other chain coffee shops.
author: L. G.

description:
Great pour over drip coffee, I had the costa rica.  Raspberry danish, I liked it warmed up.

The vibe ia relaxing, hipster.  

I would come back again.
author: Tony T.

description: My inaugural visit to Snowbird was my first visit to a coffee shop in my new neighborhood. Exciting! I quickly grabbed a cold-brewed iced coffee and a croissant ($7.50 total) and left, but noticed a good deal of seating and, importantly, that it was very clean. The coffee bar is well taken care of. Great customer service, with the 20-something barista kindly encouraging me to take my time then quickly ringing and pouring. The coffee was very strong (thinking the concentrate was inaccurately diluted) but the croissant was on par for a place this size and focused on coffee (though not worth $3.50). A nice welcome to Inner Sunset, it did the trick.
author: Brian C.

description:
I was staying with family on 11th Ave. I walked to Cole Valley for breakfast one morning, and passed Snowbird along the way. On my way home, I stopped in and had an Americano. It was really well made, and the interior of the shop is super welcoming. 

I returned the next day and tried the Cafe Bombon. It's a short shot of espresso with condensed milk in it. It was really tasty. 

Next time I'm in San Francisco, I'll definitely stop back in.
author: Brandon B.

description: I've been visiting Snowbird regularly for over a year now, and it's probably my favourite coffee place in the city. It's mostly the fantastic service that keeps me going back. Many places do great coffee, but the baristas here make the experience that much better. They're always friendly, warm and non-judgey if you have stupid questions about coffee. We like both the espresso and pourover drinks. They also have great secret menu type items - ask for a Leon!
author: Bingying L.

description: Enjoyed the breve cortado with honey. I was mildly annoyed that it wasn't served in a mug when I was staying at the cafe but the barista came over and offered to make me a cappuccino when a mug was finally available. I appreciated the gesture; hope they can stock some more mugs
author: Xteethx B.

description: Small cute place in a great location off of 9th and Irving. Got a hot chocolate here since I'm not a coffee drinker actually. Quick service, wifi, and had seating this time. I know it can be a busy place! Would come again :)
author: Emily F.

description: I am always excited about a new neighborhood coffee shop. I found Snowbird's brand  a bit pretensious  I am a latte drinker but Snowbird only makes expresso drinks with full fat milk. What;s the big deal with offering your customers choice? $15.00 for a pound of Coffee? NO, $15.00 for 12oz of coffee! Back to the Beanery.
author: Alison B.

description: This place is charming, comfortable, and local. Also the coffee is their best feature. I'll be back soon.
author: Evan L.

description: Great coffee and a fun atmosphere.  Just be careful if you are sensitive to strong coffee(similar to Philz).  I ordered the house coffee and had a mildly uncomfortable caffeine high for about 5 hours!  If you need to get shit done/be awake for a while, they got the java for the job!
author: Augie S.

description: By far the best espresso I've had in the sunset. Super cute space. The baristas are sweet and NOT pretentious. Just makes the hipster coffee taste happier.
author: L. S.

description: I always have a great experience at Snowbird. They're knowledgeable about coffee and their specialty drinks are spot on.  They're iced coffee has coffee ice cubes! The breve cortado with wildflower honey is great after my facials up the street. It's clean, quiet and cool.
author: Priya S.

description: Loved the chill ambience of this place. A smaller cafe in contrast to the larger, industrial-styled coffee shops throughout San Francisco, and was a nice shift of style. Cozy, had a few but comfortable seating arrangements. Workers were really nice, coffee was relatively average, but there were only a few options when it came to drinks/food. Interesting refillable/recyclable station in the back for what I think was various lotions (random?). Overall, would probably come back here just for the environment and for those days I want to hide myself away from society or get some work done.
author: Michela Y.

description: I've been here quite a few times and love it.  Coffee is always amazing and staff are super friendly
author: SinGlu V.

description: I'm mostly a regular coffee gal, but I sprung for an au lait here, and it was so great I moved up to a cappuccino on my next visit.  They got it goin on at Snowbird.  And bonus is the store in the back where you can be a good earth citizen and refill your bottles of dish and dishwasher soap, cleaning supplies, shampoos, etc.  Yay for good small businesses!
author: Amy B.

description: Best coffee in the Sunset, hands down. Some of the best coffee in the city. Eugene and his crew have curated some great single origin coffees for pour over, and make a mean cappuccino. Cool little spot to grab a cup and stay a while.
author: Drew W.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. Immaculate space, great coffee, and the customer service is top notch. I appreciate that they say "see you soon" as you leave, really makes you feel welcome. The care they take in crafting the experience reminds me of some of the great coffee shops in Tokyo. Right now they have beans from Ruby Roasters in Wisconsin. I'm looking forward to the rotating selection; it's nice to mix things up from the standbys sometimes. Also a nice place to hang out, and they even have wifi.
author: David K.

description: A great little coffee shop. The latte was nice and the environment is friendly. I would recommend it.
author: Steve P.

description: This is my new neighborhood favorite.  This is the best place around.  The iced coffee is really fantastic as is the espresso.
author: Miles C.

description: Finally - an independent artisan coffee in the Inner Sunset! After passing by many times in the evening, I made it over there this morning at last. Smooth batch brew, cozy unique interior. Looking forward to returning for a pour over soon.
author: Kathleen V.

description: The staff here are awesome and the tea is yummy (don't know about the coffee,, i only drink tea). They absolutely love dogs, and they have a bench out front where you can hang out with your pooch if the weather's not too bad. The decor is also great - very urban chic. The only reason I don't give it the full five stars is just because the building is kind of long and thin, and doesn't get so much light towards the back. That said, if you like to squirrel yourself away with your laptop, and you don't care about being in sunlight, then this might even be a plus for you.
author: Laura P.

description: Small "hole in a wall" cafe.  Great coffee and very friendly staff.  Would definitely come back.
author: Alan P.

description: I ordered a latte and it was tasty. Not the best I have ever had. The main reason i gave it a 3 is that they only have whole milk or almond milk. I want to try and support local businesses since I work in the neighborhood, but I prefer skim. Maybe they will add it in soon?
author: Mario P.

description: My new favorite Café. Good, limited menu. Good music. Nice interior design. Not too crowded. Solid WiFi. Not a chain. Friendly staff.
author: Raphael S.

description: Finally, great coffee in the neighborhood! The space is bigger than you'd expect so you could hang out here with a book, they have a variety of beans, some pastries and take cards. The iced coffee was amazing and instead of a bunch of ice cubes watering down my drink they use a frozen block of coffee, awesome!
author: Beth D.

description: An excellent addition to the neighborhood. The iced latte I had was legit. Strong and smooooth, coffee snob-worthy espresso. At $4 it's not cheap, but the quality is there. Their coffee bean prices seemed pretty good though. I must try them with my home espresso machine. Go!
author: McKay G.

description: Delicious ice coffee with huge coffee ice cubes! Relaxing, quaint atmosphere and very nice employees.
author: Sarah S.

description: I waited ten minutes for this boring latte? Are you kidding me?! I was so angry after waiting for so long that I didn't even want it anymore. Plus, I tipped at the counter before my ridiculously long wait which I now regret doing. Not coming back.
author: Kayli B.

description: So glad we have delicious coffee in the neighborhood again. The new layout is super cute too.
author: Miranda B.

description: 5 stars for the beautiful and delicious latte. And 5 stars for the deliciously beautiful barista who made said latte.
author: Jeff B.

description: Really nice little coffee shop. Good coffee and chilled out atmosphere. Enough space to park a few bikes and close enough to the park to make it nice and convenient
author: Jonathan F.

description: Cafe BomBon Espresso is to die for here. Friendly service and still isn't too busy of a spot.
author: James R.

description: Best cappuccino I have had in a long time. Smooth and rounded flavor - perfect with cinnamon bun
author: Beth Q.

description: Great use of space. Quality coffee for a small company. Friendly staff. Plenty of outlets.
author: Chris C.

description: A hidden gem in the sunset. Baristas are very friendly and make quite good cappuccino. Prices are reasonable. Place is a little tight tho so it wouldnt be a good spot to hang out when its busy
author: Alan T.

description: My latte was alright, but this is a great spot to sit and get some work done.
author: Amin S.

description: The Sunset needs more quality places like this. Great neighborhood vibe and super humble and friendly staff. Best Iced Mocha I've ever had - made me wonder what i was drinking before! I'll be back often!
author: Matt F.

description: Finally tried their espresso! So creamy and smooth! The batista was very helpful and friendly. Will definitely go back.
author: H K.

description: My wife and I live in the neighborhood and figured we'd give this local spot a try. The barista was friendly and warm when taking our order. We got the standard coffee house brew and felt it was standard. It tasted like a medium roast without much flavor. Value for size was good ($2.50 for 16 oz) but the coffee, compared to other SF spots, was nothing special.
author: T K.

description: Now that Snowbird is here, there is finally really good coffee in the neighborhood! The bf, a coffee snob, is so pleased. This is quality, you should check it out.
author: Claire C.

description: Tasty coffee and friendly staff, what more could you ask for? The space is inviting and quirky, which is always great. Tried their cafe bombon, which is espresso poured over condensed milk, very nice twist on a macchiato.
author: Rich N.

description: This coffee spot is a hidden gem in the Inner Sunset. I love iced coffee and their cold brew is so delicious. Even with cream and a bit of sugar the flavor profile comes through. They even used coffee iced cubes to cool the drink so that it never gets watery. They also sell organic soaps and lotions in the back in case you want to refill your sustainable container.
author: Ryan B.

description: Really cute shop!  The guys that work here on weekday mornings are super friendly.  I like to sit in here with my coffee and grab a bite in the morning before going to work.  There are some cute tables, and a lot of space to fit a fair amount of people, so it never feels cramped.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Our first time to the SF area and my goal was to hit some of the coffee shops. Very glad we didn't miss this one! Stopped in on Sunday 3/22. Loved the set up of the tables and the barista who took our order and made our drinks was easy going, friendly and welcoming. We had a cortado and a latte. Would give more than five stars if it were an option and wish we had this place in WI!
author: Lee S.

description: The cafe bombom is the nicest espresso I've ever had. Quaint little place with a nice relaxed atmosphere. Baristas are extremely knowledgeable and happy to tell you about every espresso and coffee. Another thing I liked about this place is they don't use any artificial syrups and sweeteners just honey and sugar. Oh and they also have a service that allows you to refill your detergent and cosmetic products to reduce plastic waste which is a pretty random thing to have in a coffee house but a cool little feature that I'm definitely going to try out!
author: Amy C.

description: Good coffee, and friendly service.  Really good tunes.  Always find a good place to sit here.  Good ambiance, generally.  Indie dude set up a table selling really cool local-themed t-shirts, and I couldn't help but buy one.  More places like this in the inner sunset, plz.
author: Conor K.
